question: What is the association between maternal and fetal alloantigens and RANTES production?
ideal_answer: Induction of maternal tolerance to fetal alloantigens by RANTES production.

snippets.text: Induction of maternal tolerance to fetal alloantigens by RANTES production.
we have investigated the role of RANTES in the induction of maternal-fetal tolerance.
RANTES may be implicated in the local induction of a Th1-type response necessary for successful implantation.

PROBLEM: Several studies indicate that RANTES (regulated on activation, normal T cell expressed and secreted) is able to downregulate T-cell responses which suggest it might be relevant for fetal tolerance induction.
Induction of maternal tolerance to fetal alloantigens by RANTES production

PROBLEM: Several studies indicate that RANTES (regulated on activation, normal T cell expressed and secreted) is able to downregulate T-cell responses which suggest it might be relevant for fetal tolerance i

Cytokines such as monocyte chemotactic peptide-1 (MCP-1), interleukin-8 (IL-8), RANTES (Regulated on Activation and Normally T-cells Expressed and presumably Secreted) and interleukin-10 (IL-10) are thought to play pivotal roles in immune recognition, acceptance of the fetal allograft, maintenance of pregnancy and parturition.
